page.title: 05Farming
page.content: The average acreage of farms in our area is 223 on 5 farms. These are mixed farms and all but one(600 acres) were of less than average size for S. Oxfordshire. We visited the largest farm and it has 467 acres of arable land growing 339 acres of wheat and 128 acres of barley. There are 120 head of beef cattle. A few geese and chicken are kept. From questionnaires to the five farmers we found a total of 128 dairy cows and 144 beef cattle, while there are 541 acres of wheat and barley and 370 acres of grassland and 4 acres of woodland. No vegetables or fruit were grown. The average size of field was 17 acres. All farmers had mains water, fences, hedges and trees. There were 18 barns, 1 silo, 11 tractors, 1 combine, 7 ploughs and several hay making machines.
